name: kasha
content:

buckwheat (= a small, dark grain): Stir in the cooled kasha. Add kasha to the saucepan, stir, cover and simmer for 7 minutes.
a Polish or Russian breakfast food, usually made from buckwheat (= a small, dark grain) boiled in water or milk: For a few roubles you can eat old-fashioned Russian porridge, kasha.
More examplesFewer examplesRice and kasha are the most commonly consumed grains.You may substitute rice, kasha or couscous.In Slavic countries, kasha refers to porridge in general and can be made from any cereal, especially buckwheat, wheat, barley, oats, millet, and rye.
